{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.00559v1", "title": "Evolution variational inequalities with general costs", "summary": "We extend the theory of gradient flows beyond metric spaces by studying
evolution variational inequalities (EVIs) driven by general cost functions $c$,
including Bregman and entropic transport divergences. We establish several
properties of the resulting flows, including stability and energy identities.
Using novel notions of convexity related to costs $c$, we prove that EVI flows
are the limit of splitting schemes, providing assumptions for both implicit and
explicit iterations.", "main_category": "math.FA", "categories": "math.FA,math.MG", "published": "2025-05-01T14:35:04Z"}
